intro: Paraboea rupestris, commonly known as the rock paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. This species is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers, which are often fragrant. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found growing on rocky substrates.
